summary: This portfolio is constructed for aggressive growth with high risk tolerance and a long investment horizon. Stocks are diversified across 7 sectors and emphasize momentum, innovation, and high return potential. Mutual funds are selected for strong multi-year outperformance in mid- and small-cap segments. Crypto, gold, and a touch of debt add a speculative hedge for both inflation and outlier returns. Expect volatility, but rewards can be substantial.

risk_analysis.mild_crash: In a 10% market correction, expected drop is roughly ₹13,774 (stocks) + ₹3,359 (MFs) + ₹3,400 (crypto)—total loss ≈ ₹20,533. Diversifiers buffer losses, but expect high drawdown.
risk_analysis.moderate_crash: 20% correction scenario: Equity sleeve may drop up to ₹27,549. Diversifiers soften blow, but total loss ≈ ₹32,000. Recovery can take 12-24 months.
risk_analysis.severe_crash: 30% correction scenario: Equities down ~₹41,323. Diversifiers lessen the pain, but overall portfolio value can drop below ₹120,000. Returns can take 2+ years to normalize.
risk_analysis.summary: High volatility is part of this strategy. Sector spread and alternate assets (crypto, gold, debt) reduce but don’t eliminate risks in major crashes. Investing long-term and sticking to SIPs helps mitigate panic selling.

education_tips.diversification_importance: Spreading money across sectors and asset classes shields you from single stock or sector blowups, balancing risk and return.
education_tips.long_term_perspective: The power of compounding over 10 years can transform modest annual gains into substantial wealth, so don’t be spooked by short-term volatility.
education_tips.rebalancing_strategy: Check your portfolio every year—trim winners, add to underperformers, or adjust fund/SIP ratios if sectors get too overweight.
education_tips.understanding_risk: High-reward portfolios are volatile by nature; stay invested, avoid emotional buy/sell cycles, and remember that big drawdowns are expected but recoverable.
